In [1] Roy writes

"A REST API should spend almost all of its descriptive effort in  
defining the media type(s) used for representing resources and driving  
application state, or in defining extended relation names and/or  
hypertext-enabled mark-up for existing standard media types. [...]"

Maybe I am reading too much into this, but then...usually Roy chooses  
his words quite carefully:

Does anyone know why it is "*almost* all of its descriptive effort"  
and not simply "all of its descriptive effort"? What else is there to  
be described than the media types?

Jan


[1] http://roy.gbiv.com/untangled/2008/rest-apis-must-be-hypertext-driven
